ARABIC: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰرِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Leave early for your land if you want to pick the fruit.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If you want to gather the fruits, let us go early to the plantation."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: “Hurry to your orchard if you would gather its fruit.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Go early to your farms, if you want to pluck the fruits".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: That, “Go to your fields at early morn, if you want to harvest.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Saying: "Go to your tilth in the morning, if you would pluck (the fruits)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Saying: Go early to your tilth if you would cut (the produce).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Come forth betimes upon your tillage, if you would pluck!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: saying, "Be quick to reach your orchard, if you want to gather all your fruits."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Saying: go out betimes to your tilth if ye would reap.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Get off early to your field if you have to gather [the fruits].’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Saying: "Go to your tilth in the morning, if you would pluck the fruits."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Come out to your tillage if you want to reap'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Go early to your plantation, if you are going to harvest.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:22] [saying], ‘Go forth early to your tillage, your produce (ani’ghdū ‘alā harthikum constitutes an explication of [the import of] tanādaw, ‘they called out to one another’; otherwise, an relates to the verbal action, [to be understood as] being bi-an) if you are going to pluck’, if your intention is to pick [the fruits] (the response to the conditional is indicated by what preceded it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit)) before the needy ones come to know about it.
